qas.question: Why did the English originally colonize Bermuda?
What two areas have provided a constant stream of immigration to Bermuda since the 20th century?

answers.text: West Indies, as well as continued immigration from Portuguese Atlantic islands

qas.question: Why have these recent immigrants had trouble becoming permanent residents?
When did Bermuda ease up on its immigration laws?
Why were Black politicians upset about the change in immigration laws?

answers.text: accused the government of using this device to counter the West Indian immigration of previous decades.

qas.question: Who were the English colonised by?

plausible_answers.text: US Atlantic Seaboard and Canadian Maritimes as well as the UK

qas.question: What has Virginia long had close ties with?
What did Virginia have a history of?
During what century was there considerable immigration to Bermuda from the West Indies?
During what year did Bermuda relax its immigration laws?

context: <b5_0>Bermuda<b5_0/> was colonised by the English as <a0_0>an extension of Virginia<a0_0/> and has long had close ties with the <b6_0>US Atlantic Seaboard and Canadian Maritimes as well as the UK<b6_0/>. It had a history of <b7_0>African slavery<b7_0/>, although Britain abolished it decades before the US. Since the <b8_0>20th century,<b8_0/> there has been considerable immigration to Bermuda from the <a1_0>West Indies, as well as continued immigration from Portuguese Atlantic islands<a1_0/>. Unlike immigrants from British colonies in the West Indies, the latter immigrants have had greater difficulty in becoming permanent residents as <a2_0>they lacked British citizenship<a2_0/>, mostly spoke no English, and required renewal of work permits to remain beyond an initial period. From the <a3_0><b9_0>1950s<b9_0/><a3_0/> onwards, Bermuda relaxed its immigration laws, allowing increased immigration from Britain and Canada. Some Black politicians <a4_0>accused the government of using this device to counter the West Indian immigration of previous decades.
